metadata.title: CVE-2020-11565 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
** DISPUTED ** An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel through 5.6.2.mpol_parse_str in mm/mempolicy.c has a stack-based out-of-bounds writebecause an empty nodelist is mishandled during mount option parsing, akaCID-aa9f7d5172fa. NOTE: Someone in the security community disagrees thatthis is a vulnerability because the issue “is a bug in parsing mountoptions which can only be specified by a privileged user, so triggering thebug does not grant any powers not already held.”.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-11565` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-179-generic - 4.4.0-179.209~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-179-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-179.209~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-179-lowlatency - 4.4.0-179.209~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-179-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-179.209~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-179-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-179.209~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-179-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-179.209~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-179-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-179.209~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-179-generic - 4.4.0-179.209~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-179-lowlatency - 4.4.0-179.209~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1067-aws - 4.4.0-1067.71
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'was needed ESM criteria').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-179.209~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1067.71').
linux-azure: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'was needed ESM criteria').
